subject: Gardening
title: The Oak in Celtic Culture
description: A 60-second lesson on The Oak in Celtic Culture.

hook.text: The word 'druid' likely comes from the Celtic word for oak. Druids were literally 'oak-knowers.'

buildup.text: Celts considered oaks sacred. Groves served as temples. Cutting an oak without permission was punishable by death.

discovery.text: Mistletoe on oak was the holiest combination. Druids harvested it with golden sickles at the winter solstice.

twist.text: Roman conquest systematically destroyed sacred groves to break Celtic spiritual power.

climax.text: The oak's sacred status reflects something universal: humans assign spiritual meaning to the trees they depend on.

punchline.text: Druids were 'oak-knowers.' Destroy the oaks, destroy the druids.

quiz.question: Why did Roman conquerors destroy Celtic sacred oak groves?
options: They needed timber for building military fortifications
Destroying the groves broke Celtic spiritual authority and cultural power
Oaks were interfering with Roman agricultural expansion
